result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Donald Harvey Westphal Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the restitution, fine and court costs.
Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the restitution, fine and court costs.  Restitution of $250.00 has been paid in full.
Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the restitution, fine and court costs.

1.  Complete AODA.
2.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
3.  Defendant is not to be in any tavern or restaurant that serves alcohol by the drink.
4.  Defendant is not to reside with anyone who has alcohol on the premises.

timeConds.notes: Court orders the first 6 months as straight time, the last 6 months with huber.  Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court grants sentence credit for whatever time the defendant spent in jail.

records.addlTxt:
2:07 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Court recites agreement - defendant plea to count 1 - OWI-5th - dismiss count 2.  DA concurs.  Attorney Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court dismisses count 2.  Sentencing argument by DA - requests restitution.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court orders SWD, placed on probation for 36 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
1 year county jail - first 6 months straight time - last 6 months with huber - commence immediately.
Pay $600 fine plus court costs.
36 month drivers licensre revocation.
IID - 36 months.
Complete AODA.
Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal durgs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Not to be in any tavern or restaurant that serves alcohol by the drink.  Can't reside with anyone who has alcohol on the premises.
Pay $28.85 blood draw costs.
Pay restitution in the amount of $250.00.

Court orders the cash bond on file be applied towards the restitution, costs and fine.
Court grants sentence credit for whatever time the defendant spent in jail.
Court remands the defendant immediately to the custody of the sheriff's department.

Court adjourned at 2:21 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

2:10 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Statement by Attorney Privat - requests set for Plea/Sentencing in thirty days.  Court will so schedule.

Court adjourned at 2:12 p.m.

1:30 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present with Attorney Barbara Privat.

Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives this right.  Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.  

Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Amended Complaint - waives reading.  Court goes over the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  Attorney Privat still waives the right to a preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial on both counts.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant to all counts.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 1:34 p.m.
Waiver of Prelim on June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

2:02 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Reisha Mitchell present on behalf of the defendant.

Court states an Amended Criminal Complaint was filed today.  Statement by Attorney Mitchell - indicates the defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court directs hearing as to waiver of preliminary hearing be held in approximately thirty days along with an initial appearance on the amended complaint.  Court directs the defendant to be personally present.

Court adjourned at 2:04 p.m.
addition of count 2

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.    Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:04 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.   Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Reisha Mitchell.

Attorney Mitchell confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.

Court orders bond set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions of:  Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.    Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney Mitchell does not waive the time limits as to the Preliminary Hearing.  Court directs Status Hearing - March 24, 2014 at 9:30 a.m.  Preliminary Hearing - April 1, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.

Court instructs defendant of his right to an attorney.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.
By Atty Reisha Mitchell
